textBeforeTable: These keywords can be used: Use a DIV or an HTML table that defines a slide. For example, create one row for the slide title, another one for the slide text. %SLIDESHOWSTART{ template="MyOwnSlideTemplate" }% setting. TEMPLATE setting, or per slideshow with the To create your own template topic, copy the "Default Slide Template" section below into your own slide template topic and customize it to your needs. It can be activated as the default template in the plugin's How to create your own slide template End your slideshow with %SLIDESHOWEND% Note: You can use any heading levels you like, but use the same levels for all slides. Hint: Make sure to keep each slide short enough that you do not need to scroll to see all text of a slide during the presentation. Create the slides. Start each slide with a "---++" heading and add text such as paragraphs, bullets, tables and images. Use the optional template parameter to specify your own slide template topic, e.g. %SLIDESHOWSTART{ template="MyOwnSlideTemplate" }% Start with %SLIDESHOWSTART% How to create a slideshow Syntax rules You can start the presentation by clicking on the "Start presentation" button. Presentation mode: Each heading with text is shown as a slide; the format is based on a slide template.
textAfterTable: * And for navigation buttons: %SLIDENAV% The navigation buttons for "First", "Previous", "Next" slide %SLIDENAVALL% The navigation buttons for "First", "Previous", "Next", "Last" slide %SLIDENAVFIRST% The navigation button for "First slide" %SLIDENAVPREV% The navigation button for "Previous slide" %SLIDENAVNEXT% The navigation button for "Next slide" %SLIDENAVLAST% The navigation button for "Last slide" Only text between %STARTINCLUDE% and %STOPINCLUDE% is used for the template.
